ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Origin of forces, thermodynamics, nanoscale/microscale interactions between particles.
Fundamental understanding of interactions between atoms and molecules
Connecting understanding of elementary forces to how systems interact

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strength: Very be helpful to understand many nano phenomena.

Weakness: The contents are too much for one course to cover fully.

For me it was a challenging course because it was such at a fundamental level that I would sometimes get confused as to why we were studying some concepts and what their application were.
However, once I understood those, the contents were very useful for research. The material facilitated for learning was also very useful.

I think that this course could be supplemented by having more clear connections to textbook material, as the material on the homeworks often felt disconnected from material taught in class. The grading seemed to be determined based off meeting specific wording discussed in class, and it was difficult to determine what expectations were there, as the only way to understand these expectations were through TF sessions. In the TF sessions, it felt like we needed to be told what topics to connect to the questions. Maybe the homework questions could be worded more specifically to indicate what topics to connect to.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Highly recommend to others who are interested in nanoscience with chemical engineering, mechanical engineering and material science.
Yes! It really helped me understand a lot of concepts for my research at the molecular level
I think that the overall topic of the course was relatively interesting, but it was often too simple in class, and too challenging in the homework
